etymology.description: 亼 + 口 (“mouth”): Two mouths speaking together.
etymology.interpretation: Two mouths coming together evokes speaking in unison or agreement, which extends to the senses of joining and fitting together. From this image also comes the idea of closing, as parts meet to make a whole.

examples.chinese: 我们把两份文件合在一起(我們把兩份文件合在一起)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen bǎ liǎng fèn wénjiàn hé zài yīqǐ.

examples.chinese: 请把门合上(請把門合上)。
我们合作完成了项目(我們合作完成了項目)。
examples.english: We worked together to finish the project.
